result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence P Dernovsek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence P Dernovsek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Lawrence P Dernovsek in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court instructs on DE w/o counsel.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  DE will pay a fine of $25.00/CC. provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  DE will have a payment plan of $100.00 per month commencing 8/01/16 until paid in full.
Dated 9/24/19 from WI PD.  DE does not qualify for PD services
Review hearing on June 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lawrence P Dernovsek in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE appears w/o counsel.  DE does not qualify for PD services, does not qualify for court appointed counsel.   Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts. DE would like to enter a plea of NG and speak with the District Attorney.  Court instructs on DE w/o counsel.  $500.00 sign bond,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  Set for RH 6-13-16 @ 1:00PM.
